body_html: @wdhorton yes, but my point is that a function called conv2d should never perform a 3d convolution, as it does right now when you use it on a 5d tensor. It should either flatten the input to 4d and do a 2d convolution or throw a dimension mismatch error.
body_text: @wdhorton yes, but my point is that a function called conv2d should never perform a 3d convolution, as it does right now when you use it on a 5d tensor. It should either flatten the input to 4d and do a 2d convolution or throw a dimension mismatch error.
body: @wdhorton yes, but my point is that a function called conv2d should never perform a 3d convolution, as it does right now when you use it on a 5d tensor. It should either flatten the input to 4d and do a 2d convolution or throw a dimension mismatch error.
